name: Confidence in scientists to act in the best interests of the public, by demographic characteristics: 2022
description: Confidence in scientists to act in the best interests of the public, by demographic characteristics: 2022

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_level_of_confidence_in_scientists_a_great_deal
variableMeasured.description: Level Of Confidence In Scientists A Great Deal

variableMeasured.name: field_level_of_confidence_in_scientists_a_fair_amount
variableMeasured.description: Level Of Confidence In Scientists A Fair Amount

variableMeasured.name: field_level_of_confidence_in_scientists_not_too_much

variableMeasured.name: field_level_of_confidence_in_scientists_none_at_all

notes: Percentages may not add to 100% because the nonresponse category for level of confidence is not shown. See Table SPPS-7 for standard errors. Responses are to the following: How much confidence, if any, do you have in [scientists] to act in the best interests of the public?
sources: Pew Research Center, American Trends Panel Wave 114 (2022), conducted 13–28 September 2022.Science and Engineering Indicators
